Located on the lower ground floor, the home offers a quiet, private feel away from the bustle of the street. <PARA> Property Description <PARA> The living room is contemporary and inviting, designed with both comfort and visual impact in mind. A bold, high-gloss red media unit creates a striking focal point, framing the wall-mounted television and providing generous concealed storage. Soft wooden flooring, a plush sofa bed with textured cushions, and a glass coffee table soften the modern lines, while thoughtful lighting and crisp white walls enhance the sense of space. Guests can explore the famous Portobello Road Market, browse independent boutiques, or enjoy a relaxed coffee in one of the area’s many cafés. Dining options are plentiful, with popular spots such as The Ledbury, Granger & Co, and The Churchill Arms offering everything from fine dining to classic pub fare. The area has a lively yet refined atmosphere that makes it one of London’s most sought-after locations. <PARA> Kensington offers a more elegant pace, with grand architecture, leafy streets, and world-class attractions. Nearby highlights include Kensington Gardens, the Natural History Museum, and the Victoria and Albert Museum. The neighbourhood is also home to excellent restaurants and cafés, including Dishoom Kensington and The Ivy Kensington Brasserie, making it ideal for guests who appreciate culture and quality dining. <PARA> Holland Park provides a peaceful contrast, centred around one of London’s most beautiful green spaces. The park itself is perfect for quiet walks, picnics, or visiting the famous Japanese Garden. The surrounding streets are lined with refined pubs and restaurants such as The Windsor Castle and Julie’s, offering a relaxed yet sophisticated local feel. <PARA> Transport links are excellent. Notting Hill Gate station provides access to the Central, Circle, and District lines, making it easy to reach the West End, the City, and beyond. Holland Park station, on the Central line, offers quick connections across London, while nearby Bayswater and Paddington add further convenience. title: 3 bedroom flat for rent
description: SHORT-LET <PARA> Pricing is subject to availability and season. Higher rates apply for high-season summer months <PARA> Location <PARA> Tucked away in the heart of elegant Pimlico, this beautifully designed 3-bedroom apartment offers the perfect balance of modern style and homely warmth. Ideal for families, friends, or business travellers, this contemporary home features thoughtful design, high-end finishes, and inviting spaces to relax and unwind after a day in the city. <PARA> Location <PARA> The apartment comfortably accommodates up to six guests across three bedrooms. Two of the double bedrooms feature elegant en-suite bathrooms — one with a wall-mounted shower and a separate bath, and the other with a walk-in shower — the 3rd twin bedroom has its own bathroom with a shower, which also doubles as a guest toilet for convenience. Sleeping arrangements include two doubles, and two singles, making the home versatile and comfortable for both families and groups. <PARA> The living room is a stylish yet cosy space, perfect for both relaxing and entertaining. Designed with contemporary flair, it features textured walls, soft lighting, and a curated mix of furniture that adds depth and character. Plush seating — including a boucle sofa and vintage leather armchairs — surrounds a large flat-screen TV, creating the perfect setting for a quiet night in or a movie evening with friends. <PARA> The adjoining open-plan kitchen is sleek and sophisticated, equipped with high-end integrated appliances, mirrored splashbacks, and crisp white cabinetry. A long breakfast bar with stools and a warm dining nook offer plenty of space to gather for meals or enjoy a morning coffee under the natural light from the skylights above. The result is a bright, elegant space that feels both functional and luxurious — ideal for a relaxed London stay. <PARA> Neighbourhood <PARA> Located in one of London’s most charming and well-connected neighbourhoods, this home places you within the village-like feel of the Pimlico Grid, close to the upscale boutiques and elegant streets of Chelsea and Belgravia. Stroll along the River Thames, visit nearby Tate Britain, or explore the stylish eateries and independent shops along Pimlico Road, all within easy walking distance of the apartment For dining, guests can enjoy modern European cuisine at the local Cambridge Street Kitchen, high quality fare at various restaurants along Elizabeth Street in Belgravia or a refined cocktail at the Prince Arthur or The Orange Public House & Hotel in Chelsea. <PARA> Transport links are excellent, with Victoria Station just a short walk away, connecting you to the Victoria, District, and Circle lines, as well as National Rail services to Gatwick Airport and beyond. The newly developed Battersea Power Station is also nearby — a fantastic destination for shopping, dining, and riverside walks, easily accessible via the Northern Line or a scenic walk across the bridge. Whether you’re visiting for business or leisure, this location offers effortless access to the best of central London while maintaining a calm, residential atmosphere. <PARA> Disclaimer: The property is located on the lower ground floor and features stairs to the property. <PARA> Starting rates from £ 7,400PCM. <PARA> Mid Let Security Deposit (stays of 3 to under 6 months): £1000 <PARA> Minimum length of stay (for this mid let price): 3 months to under 6 months <PARA> Council tax band: G

The room opens out into the dining room with large roof lantern offering plenty of natural light. There are French doors leading out into the garden and undercover area which creates additional dining and entertaining outdoor space. The sitting room has an electric fire and garden views. On the first floor is the main bedroom suite with double built in wardrobes and ensuite shower room. There are 2 further bedrooms and family bathroom with bath and separate shower. On the top floor is another bedroom with ensuite shower room and double wardrobe. There is also a study which could be a single bedroom, if required. <PARA> The annexe is found across the covered area in the garden. The room consists of a shower room, kitchenette and living/bedroom. <PARA> OUTSIDE <PARA> The garden is fully enclosed with bordering railway sleepers filled with planting. description: Description <PARA> Start the New Year in a beautiful new home. A large five bedroom detached property, built less than three years ago on the sought after Carmel Meadows in Mongewell, Wallingford. Throughout the property the rooms are all well proportioned and have an abundance of natural light and fluidity, which offers a great deal of versatility. There have been further enhancements made by the owners, with stylish high quality finishes being introduced throughout. Available on an unfurnished basis. No smokers. White goods are included. <PARA> There is a lovely open aspect to the front, and a private rear garden which benefits from a beautiful sunny aspect. Accommodation is over three levels and comprises of: An entrance hallway with a large cloakroom and a storage cupboard. The hallway and kitchen/family room have wood effect amtico flooring. A sitting room (with large storage cupboard), and at the rear overlooking the garden there is a double aspect living room with french doors opening onto the garden. The 20 ft kitchen/family room runs the length of the property, with a dining area at the rear with French doors opening onto a sheltered patio area, with outside electric points. The high quality `Lanzet` kitchen has a range of integral Bosch appliances including a double oven, separate microwave/combination oven, dishwasher, fridge freezer, washer/dryer, and a five ring gas hob. There is a large `Corian` worktop which includes a breakfast bar area with seating. A `butchers style` Franke sink with a Franke mixer tap. The owner has also added plantation shutter blinds on the kitchen and sitting room windows. Dog legged stairs lead to the first floor with a landing area leading to bedroom three and four and the main bedroom 14ft 2 x 13ft 9 with a light double aspect. The main bedroom has a dressing room area with built in wardrobes on the right hand wall leading to a large en suite shower room. The family bathroom on this level benefits from a separate bath and shower cubicle. Stairs lead to the second floor where there is bedroom two with an ensuite shower room and large built in wardrobes, a further large storage cupboard, and bedroom five. <PARA> Outside <PARA> The front is set back well from the road, with a driveway providing ample parking, and with access to the garage. The front garden has an area of lawn with shrub borders. A post and rail wooden fence and a pathway to the front door. <PARA> Garage <PARA> Measuring 20ft5 x 10`2 light and power, metal up and over door and a door with access to the rear garden/patio area. <PARA> Rear Garden <PARA> Enjoys a private sunny aspect and is not immediately overlooked. A large private sheltered patio area at the rear, which leads directly off the kitchen/dining room and the living room, making it perfect for al fresco entertaining. Close lapped fencing surrounding with attractive borders, and a portuguese laurel hedge growing across the rear with a row of Silver Birch trees and a small feature corner bed. The garden is mainly laid to lawn, and has an outside tap and electric. <PARA> Location <PARA> Carmel Meadows, Mongewell is located to the east of Wallingford, joined by the Thames Path that runs along the river. It is well positioned for it`s excellent commuting links. <PARA> This sought after development is renowned for its picturesque setting, being surrounded by undulating countryside, and has a private communal meadow, in addition to a beautifully landscaped wild flower play area. Within a stones throw from the property there are a number of surrounding footpaths and bridleways, including a bridleway up `Grimms Dyke` linking to The Ridgeway towards Ipsden. The final photograph depicts `Carmel Meadows` from the top of The `Ridgeway`. The village is a small quiet hamlet set back from the road and enjoying a peaceful spot. The Thames Path continues to the nearby villages of North Stoke, South Stoke and Goring <PARA> From Carmel Meadows, Wallingford is a picturesque stroll 1.5 miles along the Thames Path in the other direction. Wallingford is a historic market town, offering comprehensive shopping facilities and several recreational pastimes. The larger towns of Henley, Reading and Oxford are easily accessible providing further amenities.Road communications are excellent, providing good access to Reading, Oxford, motorway links, and with a main line train station to Paddington from Didcot 40 mins, Cholsey 55 mins both with commuter services. <PARA> The area is renowned for it`s excellent selection of state and private schooling, which includes The Oratory, Abingdon School, Pangbourne College, Radley, The Abbey, Queen Anne`s, Cranford House and Milford Preparatory. <PARA> There are sporting and social activities of all types in the area including golf at Henley, Temple and The Springs, horse racing at Ascot, Newbury & Windsor, along with fishing & boating on the River Thames. There is a delightful selection of restaurants & pubs in the area. <PARA> Outgoings <PARA> Conucil tax band F <PARA> what3words /// <PARA> reported.swooning.miracles <PARA> Notice <PARA> All photographs are provided for guidance only. <PARA> Redress scheme provided by: The Property Ombudsman (D12072) <PARA> Client Money Protection provided by: NFOPP (A.R.L.A) (NFOPP (A.R.L.A)) <PARA>

Higher rates apply for high-season summer months <PARA> Location <PARA> This spacious three-bedroom house is located in the desirable neighbourhood of Bermondsey, just a short stroll from local attractions. <PARA> The Space <PARA> Situated on the ground floor, this spacious London home comfortably accommodates up to six guests, making it perfect for families or groups. The smoke-free property features a welcoming living room, three well-appointed bedrooms, two modern bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, and a charming terrace. <PARA> Property Description <PARA> The inviting living room boasts a comfortable sofa, a dining table for shared meals, and a Smart TV for your entertainment needs. The contemporary kitchen is fully equipped with high-end appliances and all the necessary cooking utensils, making it easy to prepare anything from quick snacks to gourmet dinners. <PARA> The bedrooms include a luxurious king bed, a double bed, and two single beds, ensuring everyone has a restful night's sleep. The bathrooms are designed for relaxation, featuring a bathtub and a separate freestanding shower. <PARA> Enjoy the fresh air on your private terrace, perfect for morning coffee or evening relaxation. This Bermondsey gem offers modern comforts in a vibrant area rich with culture and convenience. <PARA> Neighbourhood <PARA> Bermondsey Spa is a vibrant residential area located in the London Borough of Southwark, England. Situated southeast of the city centre, it has undergone significant regeneration in recent years, transforming it into a desirable place to live and visit. <PARA> Residential Developments: Bermondsey Spa is known for its modern residential developments, offering a mix of apartments, townhouses, and maisonettes. These properties often feature contemporary designs and amenities, attracting professionals, families, and students. The area has a diverse community and a welcoming atmosphere. <PARA> Parks and Open Spaces: Bermondsey Spa benefits from several parks and open spaces that provide residents and visitors with recreational opportunities. For instance, the Leathermarket Gardens is a tranquil green space with beautifully landscaped gardens, benches, and a children's play area. There's also Bermondsey Spa Gardens, a larger park featuring open lawns, a playground, and a sports court. <PARA> Cultural Attractions: The area has its share of cultural attractions to explore. The Fashion and Textile Museum is located nearby, showcasing contemporary fashion and textile exhibitions. Additionally, Bermondsey Street is home to numerous art galleries, creative studios, and independent boutiques, offering an eclectic mix of artistic experiences. <PARA> Bermondsey Street Market: Every Friday, Bermondsey Street hosts a popular antique market. Visitors can browse through a wide range of vintage items, antique furniture, collectables, and more. The market attracts locals and collectors alike, creating a vibrant and bustling atmosphere. <PARA> Gastronomic Delights: Bermondsey Spa boasts a thriving food and drink scene. The area is home to a plethora of cafes, gastropubs, restaurants, and food markets offering various cuisines and culinary experiences. From trendy coffee shops to artisanal bakeries and international eateries, there are options to suit every taste and preference. <PARA> Bermondsey Beer Mile: Beer enthusiasts will delight in the proximity of the Bermondsey Beer Mile, a stretch of breweries and taprooms located nearby. Here, you can sample a wide selection of craft beers and ales produced by local brewers, providing a unique drinking experience. <PARA> Transportation Links: Bermondsey Spa benefits from excellent transport connections. Bermondsey Underground Station, served by the Jubilee line, is within walking distance, allowing for easy access to central London and other parts of the city. There are also numerous bus routes that pass through the area, providing additional transportation options. <PARA> Visit the Fashion and Textile Museum: Located on Bermondsey Street, the Fashion and Textile Museum showcases contemporary fashion, textiles, and design. Explore the rotating exhibitions and discover the creativity and innovation of the fashion industry. <PARA> Bermondsey Antiques Market: If you're a fan of antiques and vintage finds, don't miss the Bermondsey Antiques Market. Held on Friday mornings along Bermondsey Street, it offers a wide range of antique furniture, vintage collectables, artwork, and more. <PARA> Visit Bermondsey Spa Gardens: Take a relaxing break at the Bermondsey Spa Gardens. This charming green space features a playground, picnic areas, and lovely flower beds, making it an ideal spot for a leisurely stroll or a picnic. <PARA> Maltby Street Market: Just a short walk from Bermondsey Spa, Maltby Street Market is a bustling food market offering a fantastic array of street food, artisanal produce, and delectable treats. Indulge in gourmet delights and soak up the vibrant atmosphere. <PARA> Thames Path Walk: Enjoy a scenic walk along the Thames Path, which runs near Bermondsey Spa. Take in the picturesque views of the River Thames, passing iconic landmarks such as Tower Bridge and the Tower of London. It's a great way to immerse yourself in London's riverside charm. <PARA> Visit the Design Museum: Located nearby in Kensington, the Design Museum is a world-class museum dedicated to contemporary design and architecture. Explore the exhibitions, attend talks or workshops, and gain insights into the world of design. <PARA> Tower Bridge Exhibition: Take a short journey to Tower Bridge and experience the Tower Bridge Exhibition. Walk across the high-level walkways, enjoy panoramic views of London, and learn about the fascinating history and engineering of this iconic bridge. <PARA> Restaurants and Pubs: <PARA> The Garrison: Located on Bermondsey Street, The Garrison is a stylish gastropub known for its modern British cuisine. The menu features seasonal and locally sourced ingredients, and they offer a selection of craft beers and wines. The venue has a relaxed atmosphere, making it suitable for both casual dining and drinks. <PARA> Jose Pizarro: This Spanish tapas bar and restaurant, also situated on Bermondsey Street, is owned by renowned chef Jose Pizarro. It serves authentic Spanish dishes made with high-quality ingredients, including Iberico ham, croquettes, and paella. The cozy and intimate setting adds to the overall dining experience. <PARA> Village East: Located in the heart of Bermondsey Street, Village East is a trendy restaurant and bar that offers a diverse menu influenced by British and international cuisines. They focus on using local and sustainable ingredients to create dishes such as steaks, seafood, and vegetarian options. The bar area is a popular spot for cocktails and socializing. <PARA> The Watch House: This speciality coffee shop and brunch spot has multiple locations, including one in Bermondsey. They serve artisanal coffee, freshly baked pastries, and a range of breakfast and brunch options. It's a great place to start your day or enjoy a relaxed coffee break. <PARA> The Gregorian Arms: Situated on Jamaica Road, The Gregorian Arms is a traditional pub serving classic British pub food, including fish and chips, burgers, and Sunday roasts. It has a cosy interior, a friendly atmosphere, and a selection of beers and ales on tap. <PARA> Lokma Turkish Grill & Bar: It specializes in authentic Turkish cuisine. They offer a variety of dishes inspired by traditional Turkish flavours and cooking techniques. From grilled meats and kebabs to mezes (small plates), freshly baked bread, and indulgent desserts, the menu at Lokma showcases the diverse and delicious aspects of Turkish cuisine. <PARA> Flour & Grape offers a delightful dining experience for Italian food enthusiasts, with its focus on fresh pasta, quality ingredients, and a well-curated wine selection. Whether you're seeking a romantic dinner or a gathering with friends, the restaurant aims to deliver an authentic taste of Italy in the vibrant Bermondsey area of London. <PARA> The Woolpack: Located on Bermondsey Wall East, The Woolpack is a historic pub with a riverside location. It offers a traditional pub experience, serving a range of beers, ales, and pub grub. The outdoor seating area provides views of the River Thames, creating a pleasant setting for drinks on a sunny day. <PARA> The Yellow House: Situated near Bermondsey Spa Gardens, The Yellow House is a restaurant and bar known for its Mediterranean and British fusion cuisine. They offer a diverse menu, including seafood, steaks, and vegetarian options, all prepared with a creative twist. The restaurant has a warm and inviting ambience. <PARA> Mid Let Security Deposit (stays of 3 to under 6 months): £500 <PARA> Minimum length of stay (for this mid-let price): 3 months <PARA> Council tax band: D
